poem:
**The Ring from Armenia**

Once, at dawn's thin light,
a ghostly ring left a trace,
a bill like a shattered mirror
flashed its demands.

In bed's embrace, I thought of foreign lands,
where calls to the quiet depths
of dreams might cost me —
the price of what never was,
an echo of the absurd,
unanswered.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "O2 sent me a £150 phone bill for a call – after just one ring Recently I discovered that O2 has billed me £150 for a mobile phone call it says I made to Armenia at 5am on 25 June. As I was safely tucked up in bed at home, with my phone nearby, there was no way I could have made that call. Trying to get this refunded has been impossible. I first tried". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
